# videoMaxFrameDuration

**Instance Property**

The largest time interval the connection can apply between consecutive video frames.

## Declaration

```swift
var videoMaxFrameDuration: CMTime { get set }
```

## Discussion

When [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureConnection/isVideoMaxFrameDurationSupported] is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], the value of the property configures the upper bound for the amount of time a video connection separates consecutive frames. The value is equivalent to the reciprocal of the minimum frame rate.

You can set an unlimited frame rate with [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/CoreMedia/CMTime/zero] or [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/CoreMedia/CMTime/invalid] (which is the default).

## Configuring a video’s frame rate

- **isVideoMinFrameDurationSupported**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the connection supports a minimum frame duration.
- **videoMinFrameDuration**: The smallest time interval the connection can apply between consecutive video frames.
- **isVideoMaxFrameDurationSupported**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the connection supports a maximum frame duration.
